li.a: Middle School Late Bus Sign Up Form
Middle School PBSIS School Store Order Form

div.p: To improve the experience, you who serve as parent facilitator, helper, monitor, and more, please complete this survey...

p.a: Please read this letter from Mr. Riscica.

ol.li: Curriculum--Update the curriculum for all grades to be current and align with requirements of the New Jersey Student Learning Standards (NJSLS) and to coordinate the elementary and middle school curriculums with Pompton Lake’s curriculum to better prepare Riverdale Students for available programs of study at Pompton Lakes High School. The program shall be led by the superintendent in collaboration with administration, staff and articulation with Pompton Lakes School District.

Facilities and Security--Maintain and sustain a safe and secure learning environment for students and staff within our school. The District will complete a full review and audit of its facilities and security to identify areas in need of updating, renovation, repair and/or expansion. The board shall interview and approve an architect for consulting on any projects to be identified and determined appropriate as part of this process.

Student, Staff and Family Education--
Develop a culture of collaboration among the school, staff, parents, and community at large. The superintendent, building administration and Community Relations Committee will develop and expand the extracurricular, outside the classroom events and presentations by developing a calendar that includes the district the community and all stakeholders.
To develop a collaborative a professional culture among the Staff, Administration, Board of Education, and where applicable the community. Create forums to share information related to health such as: Benefits fair and /or Health and Wellness and financial wellness education days for staff. Begin after school book clubs, staff breakfast or luncheon and recognition for individuals, families and businesses that share and give extra support to our school community.
Using the PARCC scores as baseline data, continuing to demonstrate improvement in student achievement in the areas of Math and Language Arts, with a focus on below-proficient performers.
Continue to write and implement curriculum in a standardized format across content areas.
Expand the Gifted and Talented program.
Continue the 1:1 technology initiative in the middle school by providing students with devices by the end of the first marking period and explore the expansion of this initiative to other users.

section.p: The ultimate goal for our students is to achieve individual academic success by being self-directed, self-disciplined, and responsible. It is the expectation of this school district that all pupils achieve the New Jersey Student Learning Standards, at all grade levels.
